content:
Wow, that's so cool that you saw bear tracks near Point Lobos State Natural Reserve! Yes, it's not uncommon to see bears in coastal areas, especially in California where their habitats overlap. It's great that you were aware of your surroundings and took note of the signs.

I'm glad to hear that you had an amazing road trip, though! The scenery along Highway 1 is truly breathtaking, and Cannery Row is always a fun stop. The Monterey Bay Aquarium is incredible, too - have you ever seen the sea otters or the jellyfish exhibit?

Pacific Grove is such a charming town, and I'm sure your Airbnb was a great base for exploring the area. Did you have a favorite meal or restaurant during your trip? California coastal cuisine is amazing, with all the fresh seafood and produce.

By the way, since you mentioned scenic drives, have you ever considered exploring the Eastern Sierra's scenic byways? There are some incredible routes that take you through stunning mountain landscapes, alpine lakes, and picturesque towns. If you're interested, I can recommend some routes and attractions for your next trip!
